meanings.definition: A person with normal color vision, possessing three types of color receptors in the eyes.
meanings.sent1: The trichromat could easily distinguish between the red, green, and blue colors.
meanings.sent2: The doctor confirmed that she was a trichromat after conducting a color vision test.
meanings.sent3: The trichromat was the star of the art class, always picking the perfect shades for their paintings.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like those of a trichromat, seeing the world in vibrant hues others could only dream of.
meanings.sent5: Being a trichromat meant she could enjoy the full spectrum of colors nature had to offer.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to trichromacy, the ability to perceive colors through three different types of cones in the eyes.
meanings.sent1: The trichromat vision allowed her to appreciate the rainbow in all its glory.
meanings.sent2: The artist's trichromat perception influenced the vivid colors in his paintings.
meanings.sent3: The trichromat party decorations made the event look like a colorful wonderland.
meanings.sent4: Her trichromat view of the world painted everything in a bright and cheerful light.
meanings.sent5: The trichromat filter on the camera enhanced the beauty of the landscape, capturing every hue perfectly.
